Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 34th overall pick, by St. Louis in 1966...
Injured on 7/10/1967 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 4/18/1972, off Bob Lee (NYM)...
Traded from St. Louis to Cleveland on 6/12/1972 (Going to STL: P M. Proly. Going to CLE: LF J. Kennedy, 3B M. Trillo)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/20/1972, off Al Downing (NYY)...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (A) on 6/20/1972...
Won Gold Glove Award at Centerfield in 1973...
